sect1.title: Linux
sect1.para: When you want to produce readable versions of the documentation, you need some programs on you're system.

sect1.title: Windows
sect1.para:
On Windows the tools are directly available as they are on most *nix systems. You have to download the following tools:
Windows ports of libxml2, libxslt, iconv and zlib: http://www.zlatkovic.com/libxml.en.html
Docbook XML DTDs: http://www.docbook.org/xml/index.html
DocBook XSL Stylesheets: http://docbook.sourceforge.net/projects/xsl/

It is very easy to install these programs. Just unpack it into a directory of your choose (eg. c:\unix\). Before you can compile the documents, you have to add the bin directory (eg. c:\unix\bin) to the PATH variable.

You can do this by right-click on My Computer and then left-click on properties. Then go to the Advanced tab and click on Environment Variables. Here you can find all environment variables of the current user and the system. Search for a variable called PATH and edit it. When you can't find it, you can add it.
